intro: Carpodinus incerta, commonly known as the uncertain podwort, is a rare and little-studied plant belonging to the family Lepidobotryaceae. It is characterized by its small, herbaceous growth habit and possesses distinctive, clustered inflorescences with tiny, white to pale green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in temperate regions with cool, humid climates. Its leaves are usually opposite, ovate to lanceolate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Due to its limited distribution and low population numbers, Carpodinus incerta is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
